data.title: California Academy of Sciences
data.meta_description: The California Academy of Sciences is a science museum—and scientific and educational institution—located in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park.
data.text:
Exhibits and shows for explorers of all ages

NOW PLAYING

Spark: The Universe in Us

Everything we are was written in the stars. Trace the celestial origins of the building blocks of life in the Academy's newest original planetarium film.

OPEN DAILY

California: State of Nature

You are here. So is nature. In a colorful, captivating new exhibition, discover how California’s iconic ecosystems are connected to each other—and to you.

1

Events and activities to kick-start your curiosity

MULTIPLE TIMES DAILY

Animal programs

Are you a penguin person? Alligator admirer? Coral reef connoisseur? Plan your visit around animal feedings and demonstrations, scheduled throughout the day.

THURSDAYS | 6-10 PM | 21+

NightLife

Wonder what our animals get up to once the sun goes down? Find out at the Academy's weekly event that illuminates the unusual intersection of art and science.

1

World-changing science starts here

AUGUST 5–31 ONLY

Adopt a butterfly

The butterflies of Osher Rainforest tell a colorful conservation story. Support their journey from cocoon to canopy with a symbolic adoption for just $10/month.

MEMBERSHIPS START AT $99

Join, renew, or donate

Keep up with your favorite creatures by visiting for free all year long—and support our research, education, and access initiatives while you're at it.

1

3

Purple
